column4: ok, found the problem... I have 2 soundcards... for _some_ reason it detected my soudcards differently on this boot (swapped 1 and 0)
is one of them a usb camera?
no, one of my soundcards is not a usb camera
I'm not sure you need to...cant you just select the card in prefences -> sound
system-> prefs-> sound
Default Sound card
i'm gonna try rebooting and see if the soundcards are detected as normal this time :)
ok, I rebooted and now the cards have swapped addresses again, how do I make them _not_ do this?
did you set your default sound card in the prefs?
by the way, you dont need to completely reboot...in a terminal do "sudo init 1"  that will bring you run level 1...then go back to run level 5 by tying "init 5"
yes, default sound card set
nice
so the default sound card is correct and you get no sound?
now try typing "alsamixer" on the command line...use the arrows to pump up all the volumes
no i get sound, I just have to change the settings on every program to point to the other soundcard everytime
negative...default sound card should do it
most of my programs use a hardware address
oh..hmm...like /dev/dsp?
like hw:0,0 or /dev/dsp1
hmm..not sure...Maybe you can change swap the sound card pci slots
one is onboard....
mabey if i manually load one of the modules first ?
you have exhausted my expertise
this is an odd problem... tnx for your help :)
